ygData.msgSnippet: ... I see sleepless nights ahead.. Allrighty, we ll keep all that in mind while planning our course of action from here on. I think we ll get the whole thing

On Wed, 19 Jun 2002, Tom Ricket wrote:

> Howdy again, folks!
>
> In addition to DPH's list of "things to do," one main thing to do is to get
> the original source code actually compiling, either as a full project, or
> (more likely) as individual files for the new system.  The original code
> used Watcom C++ (10.0a), along with some custom assembly routines for the
> graphics and (I think) sound.  So some files will probably compile easily,
> while others will be more difficult.  I also don't remember if our original
> code was 16-bit or 32-bit, so that may also take some tweaking.

I see sleepless nights ahead.. Allrighty, we'll keep all that in mind
while planning our course of action from here on. I think we'll get the
whole thing compiling first (maybe after replacing the assembly), then go
from there.

> Anyway, I've zipped up everything of our source -- it's about 4.5 megs with
> all the gunk.  If need be, I can create a pared-down version of just source
> files and existing data files.  I've also created a "Tom Ricket" account at
> SourceForge and posted a comment in the forums .. let me know what'll work
> best.

4.5 megs is good. I replied to the comment with what would work best for
the OpenGlad team.

>
> For the licensing -- yes, it's been long enough (and we're not working on it
> anymore), that we'd be happy to provide it under a standard open source /
> GPL / something-or-other license .. let me know what you need and I can get
> any standard forms listed :)

Awesome. GPL would be best, as that's what we're planning on releasing the
project under.

Thanks again.

- Zardus
